valueCoding.display: CONTINENT-Complete control [includes use of indwelling urinary catheter or ostomy device that does not leak urine or stool]
USUALLY CONTINENT-BLADDER, incontinent episodes once a week or less; BOWEL, less than weekly
OCCASIONALLY INCONTINENT-BLADDER, 2 or more times a week but not daily; BOWEL, once a week
FREQUENTLY INCONTINENT-BLADDER, tended to be incontinent daily, but some control present (e.g., on day shift); BOWEL, 2-3 times a week
INCONTINENT-Had inadequate control BLADDER, multiple daily episodes; BOWEL, all (or almost all) of the time
CONTINENT-Complete control [includes use of indwelling urinary catheter or ostomy device that does not leak urine or stool]
USUALLY CONTINENT-BLADDER, incontinent episodes once a week or less; BOWEL, less than weekly
OCCASIONALLY INCONTINENT-BLADDER, 2 or more times a week but not daily; BOWEL, once a week
FREQUENTLY INCONTINENT-BLADDER, tended to be incontinent daily, but some control present (e.g., on day shift); BOWEL, 2-3 times a week
INCONTINENT-Had inadequate control BLADDER, multiple daily episodes; BOWEL, all (or almost all) of the time

item.text: Summary of National Quality Indicator Program Data
Please note: corrections to any of the items below must be made in the care recipient's clinical record in AutumnCare and then refreshing this document
Care recipient was absent from the home for the entire quarter?
Care recipient is receiving end-of-life care
Care recipient was assessed for Hospitalisation?
Detailed record of active pressure injuries
Environment where pressure injury was acquired
Care recipient witheld consent for pressure injury assessment?
Care recipient was assessed but did not have any pressure injuries

calculatedExpression.expression: count(../Detailed record of active pressure injuries) = 0
